title: What is the mass of an object on earth if it's weight is 120 N and the acceleration, due to gravity, is 10 ms-2? - Quora

response.answer_text: Really there is no point in asking homework questions on Quora. If you don’t want to do them, fine. But what’s the point of having someone answer a question for you when searching that answer is the whole point? The answer itself is meaningless. The only thing that matter is that you figured out how to find it.
F → Force ( Weight of the object ) = 120 N a → Acceleration due to gravity = 10m/s^2 m → Mass of the object Since , F = m X a m = 120 / 10 m = 12 kilogrammes
